physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At presentation, oxygen saturations varied from 83% to 97%. Echocardiogram showed 3 arterial trunks. Cardiac catheterization confirmed equivalent pressure measurements in LV and RV.

The first patient presented with profound cyanosis, requiring intubation and ventilation. Echocardiogram revealed 3 large (3 x 35 mm) hyperechogenic masses on the tricuspid valve causing severe stenosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Pre-discharge echocardiogram showed growth of tricuspid valve masses with moderate stenosis and mild insufficiency.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The younger brother had severe tricuspid valve obstruction and pulmonary hypertension at birth. Echo confirmed a large tricuspid mass (16 x 318 mm) causing severe stenosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient required urgent surgery after 21 days due to recurrent hypoxic spells.
